results.title: How to investigate vocations
results.brief_description: Intended to motivate youngsters to investigate vocations and determine the kinds of work for which they are best suited. The film illustrates how to interpret vocational guidance tests, how to apply their information to different vocations, how to raise questions related to a specific job and how to gain actual job experience by taking employment during vacations.

results.title: How to interview and hire the right people: a step-by-step guide for managers and supervisors: workbook [text]
results.brief_description: The right staff are asset to any business. This workbook, which accompanies the video set, enables managers to improve their skills in the interviewing and selection of staff.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.3
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn powerful new ways to control the flow of information by using the key question guide to keep interviews on track in order to get the required information. We learn to compile and analyse the interview information to reach a smart hiring decision. Interview and hiring skills are too important to “pick up as you go”. This program provides complete and professional training in how to select employees who will contribute positively to your organisation.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.2
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn effective ways of getting candidates to move beyond rehearsed answers and provide the “whole” truth and how to clarify and quantify reaction to each candidate. We learn to conduct an interview where everyone is comfortable and open through an interviewing system that stops the guessing games.

results.title: How to interview & hire the right people. V.1
results.brief_description: In this seminar presentation with Stephen Carline, we learn that when people don’t succeed, it is rarely because they lack skills or credentials. It is usually because they don’t fit in. This program helps to find the ones who will fit. Learn powerful new ways to determine what you really need in the position by learning to write job descriptions that help you define excactly what you are seeking. Discover how to see past resume hype by preparing pertinent questions to get a clear picture of each candidate’s track record.

results.title: How to innovate
results.creator_credit: Bruce Moir, Janet Isaac and Film Australia
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Innovations”.
One of three films for use in the process of educating teachers about the nature and benefits of innovation in the school. Contains a series of trigger items or vignettes separated by blank film to allow the projector to be stopped for discussion purposes. It is essential that these films be previewed to assess suitability for the audience and to enable preparation for discussion.

results.title: How to improve your squash
results.brief_description: Geoff Hunt, world champion, shows and tells beginners and squash players of all grades how to play and improve their game. Basic stroke play and game skills are examined thoroughly.

results.title: How to have an accident in the home
results.creator_credit: Walt Disney Productions and Charles Nichols
results.brief_description: Mr Donald Duck, an average citizen, avoids numerous hazards on his way home from work, only to find that instead of being safe at home he is surrounded by all sorts of modern conveniences for accidents. Littered stairways, overloaded electric circuits, loose rugs, cleaning fluid and gas stoves combined with his own carelessness result in a series of vioolent explosions and other mishaps.

results.title: How to Hand Make Recycled Paper
results.brief_description: An easy to follow video demonstrating how to handmake unique and beautiful paper by recycling your own waste paper at home. Its clean, its fun and its simple. An ideal hobby or craft for the creative individual, groups of friends, or as a classroom exercise. There are sections covering equipment, the basic paper making process, creative techniques and uses for your personalised paper. Entertaining and educational. Presented by Louise Arnott and Hector Malacaria, two energetic, young people, helping to create a cleaner and healthier environment.
